skills.name: Know that probabilities must lie between 0, impossible, and 1, certain
Know that the probabilities of exhaustive events must sum to 1
Assign probabilities to single events using fractions

explanations.A: Be careful! Remember the probability of an event happening must always be between 0 and 1. Which of these means no chance of the event happening? Which means an event will definitely happen?
explanations.B: Watch out! If something is unlikely to happen this isn't the same as saying the chance of something happening is impossible. With 'unlikely' there is still a tiny chance of the event occurring.
explanations.C: Remember, probabilities range from 0 to 1. I think you may be thinking that probabilities range from -1 to 1.
explanations.D: The lowest a probability can be is 0, so the event is impossible.

explanations.C: Not quite! It feels sensible that a very low number such as 0.00000001 could be the correct answer, but an event with the probability of 0.00000001 still has a  very small chance of occurring.
explanations.D: Not quite! Probabilities can only range from 0 to 1, therefore we cannot use infinity to indicate the probability of an event occurring.
